Routine Cell culture • TIMING 2 hours / week
Wild-type CHO \(CHO-k1) cells and CHO-mGluR1α cells were a gift from Prof. S. Nakanishi at Kyoto University.
They were cultivated in 25 cm<sup>2</sup> cell culture flasks with 10 mL DMEM/F12 medium.
Cells were grown to confluence in the presence of humidified air, 5% CO<sub>2</sub>, at 37°C.
Cells were passed once per week and allowed to grow to 70% confluence \(approximately 1.5×10<sup>6</sup> cells) between passages.

Although the expression of mGluR1α in CHO-mGluR1α cells is thought to be constant, we checked receptor activity once per week by fura-2 based Ca<sup>2+</sup> imaging<sup>17</sup> using a fraction of the cells.
